com.garmin.health

Class AbstractDeviceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.garmin.health.AbstractDeviceManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeviceManager

    public abstract class AbstractDeviceManager
extends Object
    Abstract device manager that includes behaviors common to the both the Companion and Standard SDKs

    • Method Detail

      • getDeviceManager

        public static DeviceManager getDeviceManager()
        Returns the DeviceManager singleton held by the Health SDK
        Returns:
        DeviceManager singleton instance
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if GarminHealth.initialize(Context, boolean, String) has not been called or was called and failed.

      • getPairedDevices

        public Set<Device> getPairedDevices()
        Gets a set of the currently paired Devices. Device instances retrieved from this call should be used transiently then garbage collected. Devices can be passed between Android app components by passing the device mac address through a parcel to another fragment or activity. The new component should retrieve the device again on creation.
        Returns:
        the set of paired devices or null if the Garmin Health Service is not available.

      • getDevice

        public <T extends Device> T getDevice(String macAddress)
        Gets a currently paired Device associated with the given MAC address.
        Parameters:
        macAddress - the MAC address of a paired device.
        Returns:
        a paired Device, or null if no paired device exists with that address.
        See Also:
        BluetoothDevice.getAddress()

      • forget

        public boolean forget(String macAddress)
        Forgets about a currently paired device. This device will be removed from Health SDK databases and will not reconnect to the SDK in the future. In the
        Parameters:
        macAddress - the MAC address of the device to forget
        Returns:
        boolean representing whether the device was successfully forgotten.
        See Also:
        CoreDevice.address()

      • getLoggingState

        public Future<?> getLoggingState(String address,
                                 DataSource source,
                                 <any> consumer)
        Retrieve the current logging state for a provided data source.
        Parameters:
        address - the MAC address of a paired device
        source - data source to be queried.
        consumer - consumer exposing the current logging state.

      • setLoggingStateWithInterval

        public Future<?> setLoggingStateWithInterval(String address,
                                             DataSource source,
                                             boolean state,
                                             int interval,
                                             <any> consumer)
        Set the logging state for a values that requires an interval on a given device.
        Parameters:
        address - the MAC address of a paired device
        source - logging data source to be queried.
        state - boolean state for the accelerometer logging enabled or disabled.
        interval - interval for accelerometer logging.
        consumer - consumer returning the result of the logging update.

      • setLoggingState

        public Future<?> setLoggingState(String address,
                                 DataSource source,
                                 boolean state,
                                 <any> consumer)
        Set the logging state of a provided data source on a paired device. For data types that usually require a custom parameter to be enabled (i.e. Accelerometer) using this method will result in the default value being assigned for this parameter.
        Parameters:
        address - the MAC address of a paired device
        source - logging data source to be queried.
        state - boolean state for logging enabled or disabled.
        consumer - consumer returning the result of the logging update.

      • hasLoggedData

        public void hasLoggedData(String macAddress,
                          <any> callback)
        Check for databased logging data by device. Data will have minute level precision.
        Parameters:
        macAddress - device address for query.
        callback - consumer for userCallback result.

      • hasLoggedData

        public void hasLoggedData(String macAddress,
                          long startTimestamp,
                          long endTimestamp,
                          <any> callback)
        Check for databased logging data by device on a unix timestamp interval. Data will have minute level precision.
        Parameters:
        macAddress - device address for query.
        endTimestamp - timestamp ending the epoch.
        startTimestamp - timestamp starting the epoch.
        callback - consumer for userCallback result.

      • getLoggedDataForDevice

        public void getLoggedDataForDevice(String macAddress,
                                   long startTimestamp,
                                   long endTimestamp,
                                   <any> callback)
        Get logged data for a given device on an interval between two unix timestamps.
        Parameters:
        macAddress - string representing the address of a device.
        startTimestamp - Unix timestamp representing the beginning of the data period.
        endTimestamp - Unix timestamp representing the end of the data period.
        callback - consumer for userCallback result.
